Package com.android.slackandhay.gameobject.component

This package contains all components the game object can have to extend its functionality

See:
          Description

Class Summary
GOComponent Components are what makes gameObjects functional: as the constituting parts of their parent object, they can add properties, behavior or certain services to it.
GOComponentAI this class represents the AI component used in the game, it is inherited inside the presets for real functionality.
GOComponentControl this class represents how game objects are controlled, meaning right now that they be controlled via an AI or the hardware controls (like the touch screen) The ComponentAI and the ComponentInput inherit this class
GOComponentDefense A component of this type handles damage that is dealt by other gameObjects, which means it literally decided what to do with it.
GOComponentGraphics This Component lets game objects be rendered on the screen
GOComponentHealth This type of component represents the idea that there is a certain amount of damage a gameObject can take before it will be considered 'dead' or 'destroyed'.
GOComponentInput This component is used to take inputs from touch screen to start player actions
GOComponentManager This class is used to manage all the components of a game object
GOComponentMovement A component of this type implements movement on a macro level, that is, it can be given a target point in world coordinates and it will do its best (which can amount to as little or as much as the implementation cares) to get there.
GOComponentOffense A component of this type is able to deal damage to other gameObjects.
GOComponentPlayer Deprecated. was once the input for the player
GOComponentSound This component is used to generate sounds for the game objects
GOComponentSpatial This component provides a location and an orientation in space, which is currently limited to two dimensions.
 

Enum Summary
GOComponentType  
 

Package com.android.slackandhay.gameobject.component Description

This package contains all components the game object can have to extend its functionality
